intro: Stichorkis longissima, commonly known as the long-stemmed stichorkis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the plant is known for its delicate appearance. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive floral display.
